sourceFile: NPS Interview Transcript_011225_Greg, TriSummit Utilities Inc.docx
overview: Greg Aarssen, director and chair of compensation and governance committees at TriSummit Utilities (a Canadian utility holding company), had his first direct experience with CompanyA for a CEO search. The company needed to replace their CEO who resigned, and CompanyA was chosen over three other firms based on their deep understanding of the business, culture, and existing relationships with Alta Gas (the parent company). The process was completed in two months instead of the expected 4-5 months. CompanyA conducted both an internal candidate assessment and external market survey. The internal candidate was ultimately selected after extensive psychometric testing. Greg praised the responsiveness, proactive communication, and personalized approach of ConsultantA and Craig King.

sections.title: Role and Background of Speaker 1
Interviewer asks Speaker 1 to describe their role and relationship with CompanyA.
points: Speaker 1 is a director and chairs the compensation and governance committees at Clientcompany Utilities, a Canadian utility holding company.
Speaker 1 was previously the president of the company and involved in acquiring or building many of the assets.

sections.title: The company spun out of Alta Gas Canada, where Speaker 1 was an original board member.
First Experience with CompanyA
Interviewer inquires about recent projects with CompanyA.
points: Speaker 1 mentions this was their first exposure to CompanyA, having heard of them through past employees.
CompanyA was chosen to find a project manager for a large project in Western Canada, who later became the CEO.
The decision to retain CompanyA was based on their understanding of the business, culture, and previous relationships with Alta Gas.

sections.title: Selection Criteria and Process
Interviewer asks about the selection criteria for CompanyA.
points: Speaker 1 emphasizes the importance of understanding the business, cultural fit, and market availability.
CompanyA's ability to move quickly was a significant factor, completing the process in two months instead of the expected four to five.
The internal candidate was tested extensively using CompanyA's assessment tools, confirming their suitability for the role.

sections.title: Market Survey and Candidate Evaluation
points: Speaker 1 explains the dual path approach: testing the internal candidate and conducting a market survey.
CompanyA's market survey helped focus on the internal candidate and identified suitable external candidates.
The process involved psychometric testing by Craig King and evaluation by ConsultantA, both of whom were flexible with their schedules.
The internal candidate was ultimately chosen, and the report was not shared with management but with CompanyA.

sections.title: Compensation and Market Position
points: Speaker 1 discusses the compensation review conducted by Meridian Consulting, revealing the company was 11% below market.

sections.title: CompanyA's benchmarking frameworks were not used due to potential conflicts of interest.
points: The internal candidate's assessment tools were used exclusively, providing confidence in their selection.
The company faced challenges in justifying executive compensation to shareholders, requiring third-party validation.

sections.title: Communication and Stakeholder Management
Interviewer inquires about the CompanyA team's responsiveness and stakeholder management.
Speaker 1 praises CompanyA's proactive communication and ability to keep them informed.
points: The team's understanding of Speaker 1's communication style and open, honest approach was appreciated.
Speaker 1 would recommend CompanyA again and is considering additional services for succession planning.

sections.title: Feedback and Suggestions for Improvement
Interviewer asks for any areas for improvement in CompanyA's services.
Speaker 1 suggests CompanyA could improve their marketing and communication strategies.
The idea of using CompanyA for board-level coaching and development is considered.
Speaker 1 acknowledges the high cost of CompanyA but values their expertise and service quality.
Board-Level Discussions on People and Skills
Interviewer asks about the importance of people and skills at the board level.
points: Speaker 1 explains that people discussions are a significant part of board meetings, including strategic planning, compensation, and succession planning.

sections.title: The chair of the business emphasizes the importance of people in achieving business success.
There is an opportunity for third-party assistance in board-level coaching and development.
Final Thoughts and Future Plans
points: Speaker 1 expresses interest in exploring additional services from CompanyA, particularly for succession planning.
The company faces challenges with frugal shareholders, who sometimes cut corners on important investments.

sections.title: Interviewer suggests CompanyA's board services as a potential solution.
